title: Introduction to Mental Health and Related Issues
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Mental Health
description: The introductory module will discuss the basic knowledge of mental health and related issues.

title: Common Mental Health Problems and its Management
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Mental Health
description: This module continues to explore mental health in theoretical and practical settings.

title: Basic Psychopharmacology
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Mental Health
description: This module will provide students with a solid grounding in psychopharmacotherapy, as applied to mental health care.
outcome: 1) Understanding the pharmacodynamics and pharmacokinetics of common psychotropic drugs. 2) Application of knowledge in pharmacodynamics and pharmacokinetics in the appreciation of efficacy and tolerability profile; 3) Basic techniques in risk-benefit analysis when considering indication and contraindication of individual pharmacological agents.
syllabus: This module will provide students with a solid grounding in psychopharmacotherapy, as applied to mental health care. Through understanding of the pharmacodynamics and pharmacokinetics of major categories of psychotropic drugs commonly used in modern clinical practice, students should be able to appreciate the scientific basis of the efficacy and tolerability profiles of pharmacological agents. Students are also guided to develop a critical appraisal approach to the evidence basis for the commonly used pharmacological treatment algorithm
recommended_readings: 1. New Oxford Textbook of Psychiatry by Michael G. Gelder, et al. Oxford University Press, USA; 1 edition (September 4, 2003)  2. Principles and Practice of Psychopharmacotherapy by Janicak P.G. et al., Philadelphia: Lippincott Williams & Wilkins, 2001 (3rd Edition).

title: Fundamentals of Psychotherapeutic Interventions
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Mental Health
description: This module will provide students with a solid grounding in psychological intervention, as applied to mental health care.

title: Clinical Supervision and Practice 1
requirements: For students in MSc Mental Health
description: This module requires work related exposure to settings involving care of persons with mental health problems or mental disorders, in a medical (including nursing and allied health disciplines) or social setting.
outcome: 1)Identification of key psychiatric diagnoses; 2)Formulation of biopsychosocial aetiological model; 3)Risk assessment; 4) Formulation of problem list; 5) Formulation of individual service planning
syllabus: This module requires work or work attachment involving care of persons with mental health problems or mental disorders, in a medical (including nursing and allied health disciplines) or social setting. In each module, student must write 3 case reports (1000-2000 words) with case discussion with clinical supervisors assigned by the course directors.
recommended_readings: 1.New Oxford Textbook of Psychiatry by Michael G. Gelder, et al. Oxford University Press, USA; 1 edition (September 4, 2003)  2.Kaplan & Sadock's Comprehensive Textbook of Psychiatry by Harold I Kaplan. Lippincott Williams & Wilkins (2004)

title: Clinical Supervision and Practice 2
requirements: For students in MSc Mental Health
description: This module requires work related exposure to settings involving care of persons with mental health problems or mental disorders, in a medical (including nursing and allied health disciplines) or social setting.
outcome: 1) Application of community-oriented approach to case-management; 2) Development of sensitivity to family needs; 3) Application of psychotherapeutic techniques; 4) Formulation of prognostication of chronic mental illness; 5) Mastery of skills in evaluating clinical outcomes
syllabus: This module requires work or work attachment involving care of persons with mental health problems or mental disorders, in a medical (including nursing and allied health disciplines) or social setting. title: Introduction to Research Methodology
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Mental Health
description: The introductory module will discuss the basic knowledge of research methodology.

title: Research Project I
requirements: For students in MSc Mental Health
description: During the two year period of the MSc course, students will carry out a research project in the field of mental health studies under the supervision of a supervisor assigned by the course directors. Each student will spend a minimum of four contact hour per week with the supervisor.
outcome: 1) Students should be able to formulate a research proposal; 2) Ability to plan logistics for fieldwork of the research project.

title: Research Project II
requirements: For students in MSc Mental Health
description: During the two year period of the MSC course, students will carry out a research project under supervision.
outcome: 1) Acquire skills in coordinating and conducting fieldwork of research projects; 2) Acquire skills in data-management and analysis; 3) Ability to synthesize a coherent and logical research dissertation.
syllabus: During the two year period of the MSC course, students will carry out a research project in the field of mental health studies under the supervision of a supervisor assigned by the course directors. Each student will spend a minimum of four contact hours per week with the supervisor.
recommended_readings: 1.Medical Epidemiology by Raymond Greenberg, et al. McGraw-Hill Medical; 4 edition (October 22, 2004)  2.Clinical Epidemiology: How to Do Clinical Practice Research by David L Sackett, et al. Lippincott Williams & Wilkins (January 1, 2006)
